edu.missouri.WorldBankModelBuilder

Class ModelClusterizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.missouri.WorldBankModelBuilder.ModelClusterizer

  • public class ModelClusterizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a way to generate all the economic models, and group countries by it

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getCountries(java.lang.String filename,
                                                           int column)
                                                    throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                                           java.io.IOException
        Gets the set of all countries in the given file
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file to be read
        column - Index of the column containing the countries
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the file does not have enough columns for column to be a valid index
        java.io.IOException - if at any point it cannot read the next line of the file
        Since:
        0.01 2016-04-19

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sample main program. The program receives a CSV file where the first row is assumed to be the column names, and in every other row, the first column is assumed to be a filtering criterion. Which filter criterion to use can be specified by using the third argument. Any regular expression may be used in filtering. Filtering is optional.

        The program assumes all useful data to be real numbers. Anything that cannot be cast to a real number is represented as null. For this reason, the names of columns that do not contain real numbers should not be included in the domain model.

        The program generates a Bayesian network with the data and stores it in XML-BIF format. The resulting file has the filename given in the second argument.

        Parameters:
        args - An array of length 4 or 5, where the first position contains the name of the file containing the input data, the second contains a directory to save the resulting networks in, the third position indicates whether to use the Unesco model (true) or the Smets-Woulters model (false), the fourth position optionally contains the index with the values to group the results by (zero by default), and the fifth position (in the case of length 5) contains one of the NodePlacer configuration codes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input file could not be read
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the output file could not be created
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if args[2] is not a valid index because it is not a number
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if args[2] is not a valid index because it does not fall within the dataset

      • buildUnescoModel

        public static DomainKnowledge buildUnescoModel(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> data)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Builds a full DomainKnowledge model following the structure proposed in the UNESCO world engineering report. This method is included as sample code and will be deprecated as soon as file-reading support is added

        Note: this method is not a clone of /missouri/BayesianConstructor#buildUnescoModel(Map); this method adds a variable: previous year

        Parameters:
        data - A Map representing a column-majoral table, where each key is the table's header and the list mapped to is the contents of the column with that name.
        Returns:
        A DomainKnowledge model with dependency tables reflecting the relations in the given data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the lists in data are not all the same size
        Since:
        0.04 2016-04-23

      • buildSWModel

        public static DomainKnowledge buildSWModel(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> data)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Builds a full DomainKnowledge model following the Smets-Woulters standard economic model. This method is included as sample code and will be deprecated as soon as file-reading support is added
        Parameters:
        data - A Map representing a column-majoral table, where each key is the table's header and the list mapped to is the contents of the column with that name.
        Returns:
        A DomainKnowledge model with dependency tables reflecting the relations in the given data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the lists in data are not all the same size
        Since:
        0.06 2016-04-27

      • shiftBy

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> shiftBy(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> list,
                                                       int i)
        Creates a copy of the list where all element indices are shifted ahead by the amount indicated. The size of the list is preserved: Elements near the end are dropped off, and NaN is used as a filler element

        Note that, for now, i should be positive; support for negative shifts may be added at a later date

        Parameters:
        list - The list to be shifted
        i - The number of positions to shift the contents of list by
        Returns:
        A List where the first i positions are null and, excepting the last i positions of list, all the elements from list are in it
        Since:
        0.01 2016-04-19
